en: [fade_in]We will never make a real call.[/fade_in]
[fade_in]You will use your voice to answer questions,[/fade_in]
You will use your voice to answer questions, [fade_in]but we will never save your voice.[/fade_in]
How to ask for an interpreter
How to say where you are in English
[fade_in]When you call 000, you can follow three steps to find an interpreter in your language.[/fade_in]

YOU ANSWER:

[fade_in][url={1}]'Police'[/url]ğŸ”‰, [url={2}]'Fire'[/url]ğŸ”‰, or [url={3}]'Ambulance'[/url]ğŸ”‰.

Say only one service in English.[/fade_in]

000 ASKS:

[fade_in][url={2}]'What is the state and town of your emergency?'[/url]ğŸ”‰[/fade_in]

YOU ANSWER:

[fade_in]The area and state of your emergency.

eg: [url={4}]'Dandenong, Victoria'[/url]ğŸ”‰

eg: [url={5}]'Mildura, Victoria'[/url]ğŸ”‰[/fade_in]
[fade_in]Your call will now transfer to a service in your area.[/fade_in]

Your call will now transfer to a service in your area.

[fade_in]When you are connected they will ask you for the address of your emergency.[/fade_in]

Your call will now transfer to a service in your area.

When you are connected they will ask you for the address of your emergency.

[fade_in]This is a good time to ask for an interpreter.[/fade_in]
ASK FOR AN INTERPRETER IN ENGLISH:

ASK FOR AN INTERPRETER IN ENGLISH:

[fade_in]eg: Say [url={6}]'Interpreter, Hindi'[/url]ğŸ”‰[/fade_in]
[fade_in]Letâ€™s try a practice 000 call, and you can ask for an interpreter in three steps.[/fade_in]
You find your father on the floor.
He is not waking up, and youâ€™re not sure if heâ€™s breathing. You need an ambulance.
His house is in Dandenong, Victoria.

Remember this is not a real call.

And we don't record your voice.

This message is pre-recorded.

You do not need to respond.

You have dialled emergency 000

Your call is being connected...
They always ask this question first.
What state and town is the emergency in?
The state is Victoria and the town is Dandenong
Emergency services, what address do you need the ambulance?
Connecting you to an interpreter. Please hold.
They are connecting you to a service in your area.
Practise asking for an interpreter now.
Say 'Interpreter' and the language you speak in English.
Letâ€™s keep going. Practice your pronunciation later.
[fade_in]Stay on the call until the interpreter arrives.[/fade_in]
[fade_in]They will ask you questions in your language so that emergency services can help you.[/fade_in]
[fade_in]You now know how to call 000 if you need help in an emergency in Australia.[/fade_in]
